Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2007 05:54PM crami2 wrote: I agree...keep up with this..but scar tissue can cause pain. Where the nodes were taken from my lump I have pain everyday...swelling sometimes, and a white line on my mamo. Relax...but check into it more. It is your life..take control of it.

Posts.Title: Neulastia lady4law lady4law

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2007 08:00PM crami2 wrote: Get to the DOC NOW. You need some emotional and medical support. It is so scary right now that you might need some RX support for the panic you feel. Most likely those lumps are nothing, but after loosing a baby life would be unbearable, so get back to the DOC. Also, why are you alone at this time? Family and friends should make sure you have someone with you.
Posts.Title: Losing my mind KAT1 Jenny812

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2007 10:31PM crami2 wrote: Ok, here is my 2 cents worth as I faced this with my neighbor after going through it with kids and hubby to help me. She has a daughter in the area, but not so close that daily visits would work, and we are right across the street. I made lots of soups and such and froze them in one serving sizes. Stocked her freezer, preprogramed my number in her phone, and hugged her when she wanted. Since I was only months ahead of her my energy was only slightly better than hers, but the idea that I thought ahead for her ment so much. Then again, there were the middle of the night I am scared to death calls. Let her know you don't care what time she calls. Some nights I was not very awake, but letting her vent helped her. I even know there were nights were I started out awake, and hubby ended up hanging up for me as I fell back asleep. The main thing for her was that I wanted to be there, not that I didn't make it through the call. You will find the right thing to do.

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2007 08:23PM crami2 wrote: I had an ultrasound biopsy too...but my doc was sure it was bc and he was just confirming his opinion...yours probably wants to do the same...confirm his opinion. Go fo the biopsy...I had a bruise and pain for a couple days...bruise type pain. It was worth it..you can do this! Let us know results.
Posts.Title: SCARED and CONFUSED alyssasmom

Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2007 09:38PM crami2 wrote: Approx 10 years ago on my first ever mamo I had calcifications show...they were nothing to worry about in the end. 9 years later I was dx with bc after two mamos and an ultrasound...both 10 years ago and again at dx they told me it was not an early indicator of cancer with the first calcifications.....fiber and calcifications had to do with nursing my children. I believed them then and I believe them now...bc or not 10 years ago was not an indication...relax and celebrate the results.
